intro: Kitigorchis itoana, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a contrasting dark center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
